result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E Rhyner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Washington County.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  Balance of Court Costs and DNA Surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
ADOA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility on 12-28-2015 by 05:00 p.m.
May be transferred to Washington County but ELECTRONIC MONITORING IS NOT AUTHORIZED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott E Rhyner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision.  Civil judgment entered.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date: 12/16/16
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott E Rhyner in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the motion to suppress.  Witness called:  Trooper Schmidt.  The witness is sworn and testified.  Testimony Deemed Closed.  State presented closing arguments. Defense presents Closing Arguments.   State presented response.    Defendant presented reply.   The Court denieds the motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Attorney Behm has received discovery and an offer.   Attorney Gergen to advise how case will proceed at next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
and demand for discovery filed by Attorney Gergen.
statements, Motion to Supress Evidence Illegal Stop and Motion to Supress Evidence Illegal Arrest filed by Attorney Gergen.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Scott E Rhyner in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
